content:
SqlBoolean Struct

Definition

Represents an integer value that is either 1 or 0 to be stored in or retrieved from a database.

In this Article

[System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProvider("GetXsdType")]
public struct SqlBoolean : IComparable, System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
SqlBoolean

Remarks

Any non-zero value is interpreted as 1.

The key difference between a SqlBoolean structure and a standard Boolean value is that, where a standard Boolean has two possible values, true and false, a SqlBoolean structure has three possible values, True, False, or Null.

Constructors

SqlBoolean(Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the SqlBoolean structure using the supplied Boolean value.

public SqlBoolean (bool value);
value
Boolean

The value for the new SqlBoolean structure; either true or false.

SqlBoolean(Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the SqlBoolean structure using the specified integer value.

public SqlBoolean (int value);
value
Int32

The integer whose value is to be used for the new SqlBoolean structure.

Fields

False

Represents a false value that can be assigned to the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Value* property of an instance of the SqlBoolean structure.

public static readonly System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean False;

Remarks

The False field is a constant for the SqlBoolean structure.

Null

Represents DBNull that can be assigned to this instance of the SqlBoolean structure.

public static readonly System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean Null;

Remarks

The Null field is a constant for the SqlBoolean structure. For more information, see Handling Null Values.

True

Represents a true value that can be assigned to the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Value* property of an instance of the SqlBoolean structure.

public static readonly System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean True;

Remarks

The True field is a constant for the SqlBoolean structure.

Represents a zero value that can be assigned to the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.ByteValue* property of an instance of the SqlBoolean structure.

public static readonly System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean Zero;

Remarks

The Zero field is a constant for the SqlBoolean structure.

Remarks

The byte value will be either 0 or 1.

true if Value is False; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If the Value is Null, this property still will be false.

Value

true if the SqlBoolean structure is null; otherwise false.

Remarks

For more information, see Handling Null Values.

Indicates whether the current stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Value* is True.

public bool IsTrue { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if Value is True; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If the Value is Null, this property still will be false.

Value

Gets the SqlBoolean structure's value. This property is read-only.

public bool Value { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the SqlBoolean is True; otherwise false.

Exceptions
SqlNullValueException

The property is set to null.
